bookinfo.title: Building the Service Tier with JavaEE/EJB Course Syllabus

abstract.para: This book contains the course syllabus for Developing the Service Tier with JavaEE/EJB and JBoss/Wildfly. The course meets weekly via web-ex. Class attendance is required for credit. Sessions are recorded for make-up work. Exercises are provided but nothing is required to be turned in. You are welcome to seek additional assistance from the instructor before or after class and any time via e-mail.

A "week 0" is conducted prior to the course to give students (and the instructor) a change to verify their access to the webex and course materials and take care of any pre-course pre-requisites. The assignments for that week are geared at getting your development environment up and running and to provide a Maven primer for those not familar with Maven. All topics discussed during week 0 will be generally applicable to JavaSE development and will not cover details that are specific to the course. This is all about getting ready...

The remainder of the course will meet weekly for six sessions and will focus on EJB topics within the JavaEE framework. We will use JBoss/Wildfly for examples and exercises. The Eclipse IDE is also used, but other IDE's should be usable in class and instructions will be highly Maven-based and avoid IDE specifics where possible.
The technical platform for the course is JavaSE and JavaEE 7. The course materials are up to date with JavaEE 6 with on-going updates to cover newer additions based on JavaEE 7.

listitem.para: Course combines a mixture of presentation, discussion, and lab exercises to provide an introduction and thorough coverage of building the service tier with Enterprise Java (JavaEE) with specific emphasis on Enterprise JavaBeans (EJB) and using JBoss/Wildfly.
Concepts are based on JavaEE standards and grounded using a specific JavaEE provider (JBoss/Wildfly Application Server)
Lab environment is based on Maven and IDE agnostic (this is not an IDE wizard course)
